    • Method Detail

      • addNewExperiment

        @PUT
 @Path(value="/exp")
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
 @Consumes(value={"application/json","text/plain"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addNewExperiment(java.lang.String data)
        Creates a new Experiment. URI baseuri:port/mm.controller/rest/put/exp Used for creating a new Experiment and adding it to the ExperimentData, expects a Experiment with ID and a list of nodes in JSON format. Possible HTTP status codes:
      • 201: Experiment was successfully created.
      • 409: Experiment with this ID already exists.
Parameters:
data - experiment to create in the controller
Returns:
201 for successful creation, 409 if experiment with this id already exists

  • pauseExp

    @PUT
 @Path(value="/pause")
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response pauseExp(java.lang.String expId)
    Pauses the Experiment. Turns all Nodes of this experiment off.
    Parameters:
    expId - experiment ID from the experiment to pause
    Returns:
    a Response Object with status code and message body, which reports possible errors

  • reloadConfigs

 @Path(value="/reloadConfigs")
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response reloadConfigs()
    Reloads the config.xml file. After calling this function new added configurations are available for use.
    Returns:

  • turnNodeOn

    @PUT
 @Path(value="/turnOn")
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
 @Consumes(value={"application/json","text/plain"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response turnNodeOn(java.lang.String data)
    Turns all the components from a given node on.

    Address of this method: baseuri:port/mm.controller/rest/put/turnOn The node to turn on has to be identified in the message body.

    Possible HTTP status codes:

  • 200: All components of the node were turned on. No further data.
  • 404: The node was not found. Additional Data in the message body.
  • 500: Overwrites a 404 status code. Something else happened and the node could not be turned on. Additional data in the message body.
Parameters:
data - Identifier for the node in the message body.
Returns:
Response Object with a status code and a possible message body.

  • turnCompOn

    @PUT
 @Path(value="/turnOn/{comp}")
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
 @Consumes(value={"application/json","text/plain"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response turnCompOn(java.lang.String data,
                                                                                                                                                                       @PathParam(value="comp")
                                                                                                                                                                       java.lang.String comp)
    Turns the given Component from the given Node on.

    Address of this method: baseuri:port/mm.controller/rest/put/turnOn/{component}, where component is a String with the type of the component. The node, to which the component belongs, has to be specified in the message body.

    Possible HTTP status codes:

  • 200: The component was turned on. No additional data provided.
  • 404: The node or the specified component was not found. Additional Data in the message body.
  • 500: Overwrites a 404 status code. Something else happened and the component could not be turned off. Additional data in the message body.
    • Parameters:
    data - Identifier for the node in the message body.
    comp - Type/Identifier for the component in the node, specified in the URI
    Returns:
    a Response Object with a status code and a possible message body.

  • turnNodeOff

    @PUT
 @Path(value="/turnOff")
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
 @Consumes(value={"application/json","text/plain"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response turnNodeOff(java.lang.String data)
    Turns all the components from a given node off.

    Address of this method: baseuri:port/mm.controller/rest/put/turnOn The node to turn off has to be identified in the message body.

    Possible HTTP status codes:

  • 200: All components of the node were turned off. No further data.
  • 404: The node was not found. Additional Data in the message body.
  • 500: Overwrites a 404 status code. Something else happened and the node could not be turned off. Additional data in the message body.
    Parameters:
    data - Identifier for the node in the message body.
    Returns:
    Response Object with a status code and a possible message body.

  • turnCompOff

    @PUT
 @Path(value="/turnOff/{comp}")
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
 @Consumes(value={"application/json","text/plain"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response turnCompOff(java.lang.String data,
                                                                                                                                                                         @PathParam(value="comp")
                                                                                                                                                                         java.lang.String comp)
    Turns the given Component from the given Node off.

    Address of this method: baseuri:port/mm.controller/rest/put/turnOff/{component}, where component is a String with the type of the component. The node, to which the component belongs, has to be specified in the message body.

    Possible HTTP status codes:

  • 200: The component was turned off. No additional data provided.
  • 404: The node or the specified component was not found. Additional Data in the message body.
  • 500: Overwrites a 404 status code. Something else happened and the component could not be turned off. Additional data in the message body.
    Parameters:
    data - Identifier for the node in the message body.
    comp - Type/Identifier for the component in the node, specified in the URI
    Returns:
    a Response Object with a status code and a possible message body.
